Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C142 broke right after the warranty period
Reviews.Author: Silver Iris
Reviews.Content: My 13-year-old daughter saved her money to buy this camera on her own. Within just a few weeks, it stopped working. When you push the power button, it displays a message then turns off immediately. The message is "Lens Obstructed. Remove Lens Cap." However, there is no removable lens cap - it is all automated. Because the warranty period is so limited, I am now in the position of having to figure out how to get it to the manufacturer for repair. Not good. And she didn't have use of her camera when we went on vacation. I am VERY dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: Get What You Pay For, Still Disappointed With Kodak
Reviews.Author: Karl Burrows
Reviews.Content: I previously reviewed another Kodak camera and was very disappointed with its performance.  Having owned many Kodak digital cameras over the years (probably 6 or 7), the current point and shoot models just don't cut it.  Why, then did I buy another Kodak?  It was for my son's 6th birthday.  His Grandmother bought him one of the kid digital cameras with something like .5MP and he showed a knack for using a camera (he would place his toys or stuffed animals on the floor and lay down on the floor to get a eye level shot).  I only purchased this camera based primarily on price with the secondary reason being brand.  For this price, there aren't many choices from brand names and the other brands were "off brands" or weren't much better than the kid camera we were replacing.You get what you pay for.  I don't expect much from a $70 camera, but my son has already figured out how to program it to use the scene mode and has used the video.  He likes it and that'a all that matters.  I wouldn't be satisfied with the quality and surely wouldn't use it for preserving familiy moments, but it will get put to good use and hopefully will get my son interested in photography.

Reviews.Title: outstanding value and quality
Reviews.Author: Rockkeeper "Rockkeeper"
Reviews.Content: It is a great camera, at a great price....cool color, there was a clicking type sound at initial use but I have used for 3 weeks and it has gone away, uses 2 AA batteries.....still on my first set so it does not "eat" batteries.  It is easy to remove pictures from camera to computer and pictures are of good quality.  I am very happy.  I have had other more expensive cameras but this is one is the best buy for me....and it is a KODAK.......

Reviews.Title: Nice camera at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: C. Brown
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera even after reading the previous review. I am very please with the camera. The picture are extremely clear and the camera was easy to set up and use. I needed a camera for a graduation and I will not be disappointed. I am looking forward to creating lots of memories with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Had to return
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: It is a cute little camera.  But, when I tried to insert a memory card the camera wouldn't accept it.  I took out the card from a camera that I was using and it couldn't read that card. So, I bought a Kodak memory card, thinking that the camera was just being picky.  The camera still wouldn't read the card.  I tried to format the card and the camera wouldn't accept the card.I contacted Kodak customer service.  Was told to take out batteries and memory card and then reinsert after 10 seconds.  Didn't work.  Told to take card out and reinsert.  Didn't work.  Was told to try a different card.  I informed the CSR that I have already tried several different cards and the camera will not read them.  Was told that I needed to send the camera in for repair.  Forget that!  I'm returning it.I am disappointed.  It does take nice pictures.  And I thought having a green camera was cute.  I was really looking forward to using it this summer.

Reviews.Title: missing moments
Reviews.Author: quickclick
Reviews.Content: I got this camera and it does not work. it worked fine for 3 months and now that there's no promised warranty and the 'return window' is closed my camera quit. after paying $60+ for this because i want to be able to take pictures and not miss moments like i am, i am extremely frustrated and amazon is missing $60+ per month i used to purchase through them. now i pay more at the store just to ensure i can return when something is apparently defective like this camera and know what i'm getting.i expected better from amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great cheap, little camera... Requires other purchases.
Reviews.Author: Kimberly Peterson "River's Mama"
Reviews.Content: I really do like the quality of the pictures and the ease in which I can upload them from my cute little green Kodak Easyshare C142 camera. I'm VERY frugal and read reviews and price-shopped for weeks before purchasing this. What I didn't know was that this camera doesn't include a memory card- $10, or a case-$8. This camera is powered by 2 AA batteries, with an Alkaline pair being included, but Kodak does sell rechargeable AA batteries with a charger- "Kodak Mini-Charger" which I found on an auction site for $15. So, although I like my bargain green camera, the accessories I had to buy to make it function made it cost about the same as nicer cameras ($90-$95) that include these extras.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected for the price!
Reviews.Author: Amy M. Jensen
Reviews.Content: When my 5 year old's Christmas present of a Discovery Kids digital camera proved over and over to be a disappointment to her, my husband suggested getting her a cheap "real" digital camera instead.  He looked around, and chose this one.  At the time, it was only $42, so it really wasn't much more than her "toy" digital camera.We loved the color.  The camera has a decent "feel" in your hand.  We've owned more expensive "cheap" cameras that didn't feel as nice as this one.  Sure, it isn't as nice as my point-and-shoot, but for what you pay, you get a great camera!  It is also surprisingly durable.  My daughter doesn't abuse the camera, but she is a kid, so it gets tossed in her bag, bumped around a bit, and it is still working great - after over 9 months!!Now, I'm looking to buy another of these cameras for my other daughter.  I'm disappointed to find the price over $20 more than I paid last year.  Even so, I still think you'd be getting your monies worth.

Reviews.Title: I love it... most of the time...
Reviews.Author: Melinda A. Ryan
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 6 months... I really like it but the problem is when I want to review my pics, it gets really slow and I have to take out batteries and put them back in and THEN turn it on and view my pics... other than that it's a great little camera!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: Christy Berry
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for about two hours before I decided to return it. Even when standing perfectly still the pictures always turned out blurry, and the camera also had a tendency to 'freeze up' and the only way to resolve this was to take out the batteries. Luckily, the seller let me return it even though I had opened the packaging. Ended up getting the Kodak Easyshare C195 instead, which I LOVE. Do yourself a favor and put a little extra money into getting a nicer camera, no need to fight this thing!

Reviews.Title: It stopped working
Reviews.Author: Imani Ellis
Reviews.Content: I don't like Kodak cameras anymore. It just stopped charging for some reason. This is the 3rd Kodak camera that I have purchased that has done this in a years or less time.

Reviews.Title: This is the WORSTcamra i have bought
Reviews.Author: Brandy Hunter
Reviews.Content: the first one i recieved didnt even work. i sent it back and the second one i recieved worked for about a day. since then i have not been able to turn it on. i used it once for a special occasion and put it away. took it back out a few months later and the peice of crap wont turn on. and of course cant return it because its been to long. Thanks for the peice of crap!

Reviews.Title: Quick
Reviews.Author: Mark Nerbonne
Reviews.Content: Go thsi for the wife she loves it, good for a point and shoot, for myself I need a viewfinder.

Reviews.Title: My son's favorite gift
Reviews.Author: Debbie Bratsko
Reviews.Content: My son and d-i-l had my first grandchild last year and I couldn't let them not have a camera.  I got this for my son for Christmas and he loves it!  He's a little technically challenged and this is just perfect for him.  He takes a ton of pictures of my grandson, so we all benefit.  I would buy this again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: loved it
Reviews.Author: betty adkins
Reviews.Content: love it  very compacted takes great pictures and videos  love color green easy to handle but do suggest to either remove or flip batteries drains them quickly if not in use alot

Reviews.Title: not what i thought
Reviews.Author: D. Crowe
Reviews.Content: i thought i was getting a good camera but i was not the pictures were blurry and the buttons are too close to each other

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera
Reviews.Author: D. M. Cook
Reviews.Content: This is a very good camera for my use its easy to operate and understand takes good pictures and videos, I like it very much, fast shipping, thanks

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your time or money
Reviews.Author: lysser33
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old daughter saved her birthday money to buy this camera.  We trusted the Kodak name...apparently that was a mistake.  The first camera took about 5 pictures then wouldn't do anything.  We sent it back to Amazon and re-ordered.  Just got the 2nd one in the mail today and it won't read a memory card or take pictures.  What a disappointment for a 9 year old to get a defective product not once, but twice.  VERY disappointed that Kodak would even have it's name on this product.  My daughter will be ordering a different brand of camera. Stay away from this camera. Thank you to Amazon for your amazing return policy!

Reviews.Title: Junk After 10 Uses in Less Than A Year
Reviews.Author: Amanda B. Staley "Florida Amazon Lover"
Reviews.Content: OMG Im SO Mad Ive Only Had It A Year And Maybe Have Used it Ten Times And I Have Baby It And Took Very Good Care Of It And It Stop Working What A Peace Of Junk waste of $100 And Because Of That Im Never Buying A Kodak Again

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the price
Reviews.Author: young at heart
Reviews.Content: This is an awesome digital camera for the price.  It is easy to use, takes great pictures, and is easy to download pictures to your computer.  The only drawback is that it only holds about 3 pictures due to lack of better memory, but I solved that issue by purchasing a memory card from a local retailer. The other feature I really like about the camera is that it uses regular AA batteries instead of the special ones that most digital cameras require.  The battery also lasts longer than what I have experienced with other digital cameras.

Reviews.Title: Daughter loves this!
Reviews.Author: Ann Elise Walston
Reviews.Content: Great Christmas present for my daughter.  She loves it!!  Her first "real" camera.  We were a little disappointed in how non-user-friendly some of the tasks are on the menu, as they are a little hard for her to navigate.  Other than that, a success.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare
Reviews.Author: Vicki
Reviews.Content: This camera stopped working 2 months after buying it.  Same problem with my last Kodak digital camera.  They work for a while and then you are not able to turn them on anymore.  I will never by Kodak again

Reviews.Title: dont buy!
Reviews.Author: kids0109
Reviews.Content: I purchased 2 of these cameras last year on black friday. I gave one to my daughter who had the same problem with the card not reading. The worst is that when she finally got a card to work and took her camera to DC on a trip, she stuck the card into her computer to download pictures and not only did none of the pics download...her computer screen went blank and said there was a serious error - we have never been able to get the card reader on her computer to work again! Nor will the SD card work. Store says we cant return it...The one I used has the lens error. Either the camera lens wont open or it wont close. I did try to return it to the store within 2 days and they said they had no other problems reported and had sold tons of them and told me to try new batteries. I have messed around with the lens and at times gotten it to work...but now am mostly just in no camera mode.That all being said - when it does work it does take pretty good pictures for a cheap camera - and I do mean that it is cheap.

Reviews.Title: warning, will only work for a few months
Reviews.Author: Teresa L Wilson
Reviews.Content: I'm a computer tech person that dabbles in professional photography. I purchased this camera for a Christmas present an older persons first experience with a digital camera, thinking this Kodak would be an easy introduction to digital photography for her. It came with little instructions & worked for barely 5 months. Of course there's no warranty. It's frustrated her beyond wanting to try another one & has frustrated us as we were always having to trouble-shoot long distance or drive out of town to help her with it. It's a piece of junk. Keep looking as this isn't the camera I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Lois
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!! I previously bought one for myself and my niece loved it so much that I bought her this one for her birthday. She's 7. It was a huge hit. It takes fantastic pictures and they are very easy to upload. The only negative is that the batteries die pretty quickly but I just make sure to always keep spares on hand.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last a week.
Reviews.Author: Cass
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to be something easy and inexpensive to carry in a pocket/purse and bring to special occasions.  We attended a wedding 2 days after we received the product, and it appeared to work fine.  We used a 2GB memory card and took a handful of pictures.  BUT-we could not review the photos regularly-it would freeze every time we hit the review button. We kept having to restart the camera.  We removed the memory card and had the same problem.The next day, we turn on the camera and get a message that says the memory card format cannot be read.  We try everything, but alas, it cannot read the memory card we utilized the night before, full of photos.  We remove the memory card and try a different one (different brand too) and it appears to work, until the camera freezes all together and won't do anything.  At this point, we decide to switch the batteries since we were utilizing the Kodak brand batteries that came with the camera.  The camera would power up again with new batteries, but like the night before, kept freezing regularly.  So-at that point we gave up-this camera was more headache than it was worth.

Reviews.Title: Lovable
Reviews.Author: JadeKiss23
Reviews.Content: After my super old camera passed away I decided to get this one, mostly based on price which isn't bad at all, and also because Kodak is a trusted name. The camera takes really clear photos and the smart shot feature is really awesome. The camera sort of analyzes whats in the photo and sets the camera to the best setting for it, IE in motion, plants, close ups, ect. So its nice not to have to take time to to adjust the settings, you can just point and click! I haven't used the share feature yet to upload to facebook, flick, ect. But I have heard good things about it and will once I get an eye fi card.Also, one thing almost had me returning the camera. When I would be looking at the display before taking a photo, the screen was noticeably pixelized. However, reviewing the photos they appeared clear and was clear when uploading them on the computer. A few days later I got some new rechargeable battery's ( I had been using cheap ones from the dollar store)and bam! The pixels where gone! As the battery's got lower the pixels would reappear, but its not really an issue since the photos still take very clear and it doesnt interfere with taking the photos. This would be better with an ion battery in the camera, but still for the price, it's a good deal.All in all, very happy with the camera, plan on using it all summer and more for vacations, camping trips, and just fun times!

Reviews.Title: I got a broken camara
Reviews.Author: ejsa
Reviews.Content: I was  looking for  a unexpensive camara to give as  a gift to someone that does  not have experience with a digital camaras. it was a bad choice. it never works.

Reviews.Title: Great little starter camera
Reviews.Author: danis1of5
Reviews.Content: We bought this for our daughter for her ninth birthday - what a great little camera for her!  I must say, it chews through battery life like a monster :0(  But all-in-all, she really loves it, and the green is a really cool color, and let's face it - for a 9-yr-old girl, color MATTERS!

Reviews.Title: Camera great, but no sound until uploaded
Reviews.Author: cclark6000
Reviews.Content: My 9 year old received this camera for Christmas. Great pictures, easy to use, but she really wanted to take video with sound and play back immediately. We didn't realize this camera doesn't have sound until the video is uploaded. Not what we need. Overall, has worked great in the hands of a 9 year old for 1 month so far. We will return it, though, and find one that plays back sound on the camera itself.

Reviews.Title: Kodak c142
Reviews.Author: M. Gamble
Reviews.Content: This camera seemed very nice for my teen daughter- at first.  After the third day of trying to take holiday pictures, the buttons stuck and we were unable to see the pictures after she took them.  We thought the batteries had gone out, so we put in new ones.  That did not help at all.  Eventually, we had to take the batteries out just to turn the camera off. I ended up returning this camera and will purchase a different one.

Reviews.Title: Not thrilled
Reviews.Author: Suzanne "drewid"
Reviews.Content: This is my third easy share camera from Kodak. I just want a point and shoot camera that does most of the thinking for me, and takes good pictures of my family events, and vacations. Sadly, this camera is disappointing. Many of my pictures are blurry, and it's not always noticed on the view screen. I find out when I upload them to a monitor. The previous Kodaks did not have this issue, and I was always pleased with their ease of use. But after 3 months with this camera, I am looking for a new one again, and not sure I will stick with Kodak anymore.

Reviews.Title: lime green is in
Reviews.Author: Karen Fonkert "K rock"
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera for the price.  My 11 year old daughter loved that it was lime green--it's her favorite color!  It's perfect for her needs.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: M. M. Kinsey
Reviews.Content: Son like this carma but it is hard to turn on, It takes a long time to come on. Good pic. Son like it to for the share button to facebook.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pics yet simple enough for a 4 year old
Reviews.Author: Nanny D "kadid"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these cameras for each of my grandsons, ages 4 and 5, for Christmas because they both use their mother's very very expensive camera like it's their own. This camera takes excellent pictures, yet it's simple enough to use that they both knew immediately how to turn it on/off, point and shoot. The 5 year old is more into picking and choosing what he wants to shoot and setting up his pictures. The 4 year old...not so much, but he never got his fingers in the way. Sounds simple, but they did have a head start with mom's camera. The pictures came out great. Now I want one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Overall slow functionality
Reviews.Author: B. Hood
Reviews.Content: The pic takes great photos and I havent had an issue with the battery life, but the camera just functions really slow when you're trying to view or delete pics in the memory.

Reviews.Title: Camera is ok
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my 8 yr. old.. She loves it! However I would not recommend this camera for an adult. I have not used this camera all that much personally but one feature I dislike highly is that the video portion does not play audio on the camera itself. A person has to wait until it's uploaded to hear the audio over the computer.. Not well thought out in my opinion... For the price though I would say it's ok for a kid...

Reviews.Title: digital camera
Reviews.Author: L. Hennings
Reviews.Content: this is a nice little camera was bought as a present for my daughter, she finds it very easy to use and has had no problem working all its functions. would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: Rusty
Reviews.Content: For 80 bucks its a great camera. If you know how to use the different scene settings, you can get great pictures. One down side is you have to have a working internet explorer to get software to the computer. As long as you keep it in power saver for the lsd screen, your alkaline batteries will last about a week with lots of use. Durable and sleek designe, I love this camera!!!!!

Reviews.Title: quick service
Reviews.Author: James M. Bush
Reviews.Content: I have not opened the package as of this date. It is going to be a xmas gift. I was pleased with the quick service.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Jean Robert Boursiquot
Reviews.Content: This is a great Camera it does have one feature on it that i believe was more of a Beta Version for more advanced cameras, If you set it For Continous Image Clarity it will continue to use its memory to clarify each frame and probably make it overheat and eventually break way before its time, my theory is only use that function when you really need it, but still a very good camera and your pictures will come out great with all the different modes and settings.  I give it 5 stars for the price ANY DAY.

ProductInfo.Features:
10-megapixel resolution for stunning prints up to 30 x 40 inches
3x optical zoom
2.7-inch LCD with KODAK Color Science Technology
Kodak's Smart Capture feature; Face Recognition feature
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare C142 10 MP Digital Camera with 3xOptical Zoom and 2.5-Inch LCD (Green)
